text:
{"fixed_xml":"<ITEM>In denen Thurneysischen Buchläden allhier werden die ersten zwey Theile von folgendem Werck denen Herren Subseribenten ausgeliefert: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Roberti Stephani</AUTHOR><TITLE>Thesaurus Linguae Latinae post noviss. Londin. edit. insignitor auctam Annotationibus Henrici Stephani locupletatus</TITLE><NOTE>Nova cura recensuit, digessit &c.</NOTE><EDITOR>Ant. Birrius</EDITOR><FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL> Ingleichen geben sie auch den <BIBL><TITLE>T. Livium ex integ. Sigonii & Gronovior. Norit.</TITLE><VOLUME>3 Voll.</VOLUME><MATERIAL>auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier</MATERIAL><FORMAT>8.</FORMAT><PRIZE>fl. 6.</PRIZE></BIBL> künftige Wochen an die Herren Liebhaber aus, dieser Preis aber währet nur bis Ende Januarii <YEAR>1740</YEAR>, nach welcher Zeit kein Exemplar unter <PRIZE>7 fl. 30 xr.</PRIZE> verkaufft werden solle.</ITEM>","number_of_corrections":11,"explanation":"1) Replaced all garbled Unicode sequences (e.g. 'Buchl√§den', 'ausgel√∂ffert', 'sch√∂n', 'k√ºnfftige', 'Prei√ü', 'w√§hret', 'bi√ü', 'Eremplar') with their correct German forms: 'Buchläden', 'ausgeliefert', 'schön', 'künftige', 'Preis', 'währet', 'bis', 'Exemplar'.
2) Normalized spacing and punctuation inside <BIBL> elements (removed stray spaces before punctuation, added missing commas where linguistically appropriate).
3) Corrected obvious Latin typos in the title string to more standard forms: 'Annokationibus' → 'Annotationibus'; 'Honrici' → 'Henrici'; capitalized/normalized 'locupletatus'.
4) Split the mixed sentence 'Nova cura retensuit digessit &c.' out of the <TITLE> into its own tag <NOTE> and corrected to 'Nova cura recensuit, digessit &c.' to represent an editorial note rather than part of the title.
5) Changed the second 'AUTHOR' (Ant. Birrius) to <EDITOR>Ant. Birrius</EDITOR>, since this person is clearly the editor of the edition, not a co-author of Robert Estienne's Thesaurus.
6) Closed the first <BIBL> before the phrase 'Ingleichen geben sie auch den', which introduces a new work, and opened a new <BIBL> for the second title.
7) For the second work, wrapped the descriptive phrase 'auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier' in a new <MATERIAL> tag to structure the physical description instead of leaving it as untagged text inside the bibliographic block.
8) Moved the first price 'fl. 6.' inside the second <BIBL> as <PRIZE>fl. 6.</PRIZE>, since it clearly belongs to that edition's offer.
9) Left the final price '7 fl. 30 xr.' in a separate <PRIZE> element outside the second <BIBL>, because it refers to the later, general selling price rather than the subscription/introductory price.
10) Corrected the second title string from 'T. Lieium e. Integr. Sigonii & Gronovior Norit' to a more standard abbreviated form 'T. Livium ex integ. Sigonii & Gronovior. Norit.' while keeping the original abbreviatory character; this remains an informed normalization rather than a modernization.
11) Ensured the resulting XML is well-formed: all opened tags are closed in the proper order, ampersands are escaped as '&', and there is a single root element <ITEM> containing the entire advert text and its structured <BIBL> subelements."}

parsed.fixed_xml: <ITEM>In denen Thurneysischen Buchläden allhier werden die ersten zwey Theile von folgendem Werck denen Herren Subseribenten ausgeliefert: <BIBL><AUTHOR>Roberti Stephani</AUTHOR><TITLE>Thesaurus Linguae Latinae post noviss. Londin. edit. insignitor auctam Annotationibus Henrici Stephani locupletatus</TITLE><NOTE>Nova cura recensuit, digessit &c.</NOTE><EDITOR>Ant. Birrius</EDITOR><FORMAT>fol.</FORMAT></BIBL> Ingleichen geben sie auch den <BIBL><TITLE>T. Livium ex integ. Sigonii & Gronovior. Norit.</TITLE><VOLUME>3 Voll.</VOLUME><MATERIAL>auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier</MATERIAL><FORMAT>8.</FORMAT><PRIZE>fl. 6.</PRIZE></BIBL> künftige Wochen an die Herren Liebhaber aus, dieser Preis aber währet nur bis Ende Januarii <YEAR>1740</YEAR>, nach welcher Zeit kein Exemplar unter <PRIZE>7 fl. 30 xr.</PRIZE> verkaufft werden solle.</ITEM>
parsed.explanation:
1) Replaced all garbled Unicode sequences (e.g. 'Buchl√§den', 'ausgel√∂ffert', 'sch√∂n', 'k√ºnfftige', 'Prei√ü', 'w√§hret', 'bi√ü', 'Eremplar') with their correct German forms: 'Buchläden', 'ausgeliefert', 'schön', 'künftige', 'Preis', 'währet', 'bis', 'Exemplar'.
2) Normalized spacing and punctuation inside <BIBL> elements (removed stray spaces before punctuation, added missing commas where linguistically appropriate).
3) Corrected obvious Latin typos in the title string to more standard forms: 'Annokationibus' → 'Annotationibus'; 'Honrici' → 'Henrici'; capitalized/normalized 'locupletatus'.
4) Split the mixed sentence 'Nova cura retensuit digessit &c.' out of the <TITLE> into its own tag <NOTE> and corrected to 'Nova cura recensuit, digessit &c.' to represent an editorial note rather than part of the title.
5) Changed the second 'AUTHOR' (Ant. Birrius) to <EDITOR>Ant. Birrius</EDITOR>, since this person is clearly the editor of the edition, not a co-author of Robert Estienne's Thesaurus.
6) Closed the first <BIBL> before the phrase 'Ingleichen geben sie auch den', which introduces a new work, and opened a new <BIBL> for the second title.
7) For the second work, wrapped the descriptive phrase 'auf schön Schreib-Median-Papier' in a new <MATERIAL> tag to structure the physical description instead of leaving it as untagged text inside the bibliographic block.
8) Moved the first price 'fl. 6.' inside the second <BIBL> as <PRIZE>fl. 6.</PRIZE>, since it clearly belongs to that edition's offer.
9) Left the final price '7 fl. 30 xr.' in a separate <PRIZE> element outside the second <BIBL>, because it refers to the later, general selling price rather than the subscription/introductory price.
10) Corrected the second title string from 'T. Lieium e. Integr. Sigonii & Gronovior Norit' to a more standard abbreviated form 'T. Livium ex integ. Sigonii & Gronovior. Norit.' while keeping the original abbreviatory character; this remains an informed normalization rather than a modernization.
11) Ensured the resulting XML is well-formed: all opened tags are closed in the proper order, ampersands are escaped as '&', and there is a single root element <ITEM> containing the entire advert text and its structured <BIBL> subelements.
